Message Security Layer (MSL)

SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.netflix.msl.msg
Class Header

java.lang.Object
  com.netflix.msl.msg.Header
Direct Known Subclasses:
ErrorHeader, MessageHeader
public abstract class Header
extends Object

A MSL header contains entity authentication data or a master token identifying the message sender and data used to authenticate the header data. Portions of the header may be encrypted.

A message header is represented as header = { "#mandatory" : [ "headerdata", "signature" ], "#conditions" : [ "entityauthdata xor mastertoken" ], "entityauthdata" : entityauthdata, "mastertoken" : mastertoken, "headerdata" : "base64", "signature" : "base64" } where:

  • entityauthdata is the entity authentication data (mutually exclusive with mastertoken)
  • mastertoken is the master token (mutually exclusive with entityauthdata)
  • headerdata is the Base64-encoded encrypted header data (headerdata)
  • signature is the Base64-encoded verification data of the header data

An error header is represented as errorheader = { "#mandatory" : [ "entityauthdata", "errordata", "signature" ], "entityauthdata" : entityauthdata, "errordata" : "base64", "signature" : "base64" } where:

  • entityauthdata is the entity authentication data
  • errordata is the Base64-encoded encrypted error data (errordata)
  • signature is the Base64-encoded verification data of the error data

Method Detail

parseHeader

public static Header parseHeader(MslContext ctx,
                                 JSONObject headerJO,
                                 Map<String,ICryptoContext> cryptoContexts)
                          throws MslEncodingException,
                                 MslEntityAuthException,
                                 MslCryptoException,
                                 MslKeyExchangeException,
                                 MslUserAuthException,
                                 MslMessageException,
                                 MslException

Construct a new header from the provided JSON object.

Headers are encrypted and signed. If a master token is found, it will be used for this purpose. Otherwise the crypto context appropriate for the entity authentication scheme will be used.

For message headers the master token or entity authentication data must be found. For error headers the entity authentication data must be found.

Service tokens will be decrypted and verified with the provided crypto contexts identified by token name. A default crypto context may be provided by using the empty string as the token name; if a token name is not explcitly mapped onto a crypto context, the default crypto context will be used.

Parameters:
ctx - MSL context.
headerJO - header JSON object.
cryptoContexts - the map of service token names onto crypto contexts used to decrypt and verify service tokens.
Returns:
the header.
Throws:
MslEncodingException - if there is an error parsing the JSON.
MslCryptoException - if there is an error decrypting or verifying the message.
MslEntityAuthException - if unable to create the entity authentication data.
MslKeyExchangeException - if unable to create the key request data or key response data.
MslUserAuthException - if unable to create the user authentication data.
MslMessageException - if the header signature is invalid.
MslException - if the message does not contain an entity authentication data or a master token or a token is improperly bound to another token.
